page.title: 15A WALK ALONG HENWOOD LANE
page.content: The tree and hedge lined road meanders towards the junction with Berry Hall Lane. On a high wall is the notice 'Smallpox Keep Out'. This is the outer wall of the Isolation Hospital. We cross over the Grand Union Canal by way of an old bridge and onto the ford where the road crosses the River Blythe. A wooden footbridge runs alongside the road. Here can be found the disused Henwood Flour Mill. The water mill dates back some 400 years. A little way on there are some cottages within site of the M42 motorway. A lady who has lived here for 50 years describes the noise of the cars, especially on rainy days. She described the sound like waves beating the rocks on a seashore.
